definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
NHK (Nihon Hōsō Kyōkai), Japanese national broadcasting company
pinyin: Ri4 ben3 Fang4 song4 Xie2 hui4

sentences.english: As we listened to the laid back, middle-of-the-road live band, dancing was the last thing on our minds.
sentences.chinese: 聽着樂隊放送的現場演奏，跳舞是我們腦子裏的一切。

sentences.english: The loudspeakers poured forth a continuous programme of martial music.
sentences.chinese: 揚聲器連續不斷地放送軍樂節目。

sentences.english: They claim to never be around a TV when that show is on the air.
sentences.chinese: 他們宣稱從未呆在電視機前看一部正在放送的電視劇。

sentences.english: The telescreen received and transmitted simultaneously .
sentences.chinese: 電幕能夠同時接收和放送。

definition: to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
news from behind the scenes/stage gossip
to interrupt (a radio or TV program) with a commercial insert, breaking news etc/to put a call on hold
photobook (loanword from Japanese), generally sexy portraits of an actress or model
to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]
